title: To check stubble burning, Punjab to give 22,000 CRM machines to farmers: govt | Chandigarh News - The Indian Express
text:
Appreciating farmers for giving positive responses to the Direct Sowing of Rice (DSR), Khudian said, “The state has witnessed a 28 per cent surge in the area under this water-conserving technique in comparison to last year. As many as 2.20 lakh acres have already been sown directly, which was 1.72 lakh acres in 2023.” By: Express News Service July 12, 2024 11:58 IST Follow Us The minister also reviewed the status of maize kharif sowing, for which the state is providing Rs 100 as a subsidy on the purchase of every 1 kg of hybrid maize seeds. The Punjab government will provide over 22,000 Crop Residue Management (CRM) machines on subsidy to manage paddy straw scientifically in the state, Punjab Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Minister Gurmeet Singh Khudian said Thursday.
Chairing a meeting to review the status of various schemes and projects undertaken by the department, the minister asked officials to ensure the draw of lots for the subsidized CRM machines should be held this month and subsidy must be released to the beneficiary farmers by August-end, before the starting of paddy harvesting to accomplish the ambitious plan to reduce farm fires to zero.
“CM Bhagwant Mann -led state government laid out an action plan of Rs 500 crore for making available CRM machinery to farmers on subsidy during the paddy harvest season 2024-25. Farmers can avail 50 per cent subsidy on the cost of CRM equipment, while 80 per cent subsidy is for cooperative societies, FPOs and panchayats”, he added.
Advertisement Appreciating farmers for giving positive responses to the Direct Sowing of Rice (DSR), Khudian said, “The state has witnessed a 28 per cent surge in the area under this water-conserving technique in comparison to last year. As many as 2.20 lakh acres have already been sown directly, which was 1.72 lakh acres in 2023.”
He directed department officials to pull all stops to accomplish the target of sowing 5 lakh acres by adopting DSR this season. Punjab Government is providing Rs 1,500 financial assistance to encourage the farmers to opt for DSR, he said.
The minister also reviewed the status of maize kharif sowing, for which the state is providing Rs 100 as a subsidy on the purchase of every 1 kg of hybrid maize seeds.
Director, of Agriculture, Jaswant Singh apprised the Cabinet minister that the kharif maize had so far been sown in 1 lakh acres, and assuring that the target of bringing two lakh acres under the kharif maize would be accomplished.
Advertisement Asking department officials to continue the onslaught against the sale of spurious/substandard agriculture inputs, the minister made it clear that nobody would be spared if found indulging in the malpractice, “The government is fully committed to ensuring quality seeds, fertilisers and pesticides to the state farmers,” he added.

title: 2023’s Most Heartwarming Stories Include Incredible Tales of Survival, Selflessness and Joy
text: The world was a turbulent place in 2023 with fighting in Gaza between Israel and Hamas, and the war in Ukraine rapidly approaching its second year without an end to the conflict in sight. At home, mass shootings continued to claim innocent lives, a surge of migrants at the southern border reached the breaking point, and a former president faces multiple indictments from his role in the 2020 presidential election. But despite the troubles and tragedies, stories showing the best of humanity and heartwarming goodness shone through. Here are some of the best that appeared in The Messenger during 2023: When Xavier Jones couldn't get a lift to his middle school graduation in St. Louis, he determined to walk to the ceremony. Then he was surprised with a full ride. The eighth-grader hiked the six miles to the graduation at Harris-Stowe State University with his brother and a friend, recalling advice from his mentor: "If I want it, I got to get it." “So I wanted to graduate. So I was going to go to my graduation," the 14-year-old said. When his mentor, Darren Seals, announced Xavier's resolve at graduation, it caught the attention of Dr. LaTonia Collins Smith, president of Harris-Stow State University. "When Xavier stood up it was like our spirits connected," Collins Smith told The Messenger. "It was something that resonated with me." "It spoke volumes to me. It spoke of resilience, persistence, perseverance,” she said. Collins Smith offered him a Presidential scholarship to cover four years of housing, books and fees. A Tennessee mom rejoiced when she found her 4-month-old son Lord virtually unscathed after he was ripped from their home by a twister in mid-December. “The roof came off first, the tip of the tornado came down and picked up the bassinet with my baby, Lord, in it,” mom Sydney Moore said. “He was the first thing to go up.” Moore said she was in a bedroom of the mobile home with her 1-year-old son when she heard the tornado's ferocious winds. “Something in me just told me to run and jump on top of my son,” Moore said. “Literally the moment I jumped on him, the walls collapsed.” As she protected her 1-year-old, her fiancé ran to the front of the home to grab Lord, but they were both swept away. Once the storm passed, Moore and her fiancé found Lord in a tree with just a cut on his ear. “I thought he was dead,” Moore said. “I was pretty sure he was dead and we weren’t going to find him. But he’s here, and that’s by the grace of God.” When Jimmy Tomredle , a senior at a New Jersey high school, heard that some of his fellow students were not coming to school because they were being bullied due to dirty clothes, he did something about it. He learned that the students wore soiled clothes because their parents didn't have the money or the time to wash them at home. “I thought bringing free laundry services would be beneficial,” Tomredle, the class president at Lacey Township High School, told The Messenger this June. He contacted local appliance stores, arranged for a washer and dryer to be donated and installed them in a private area of the school. "Tomredle’s Terrifically Tidy Laundry Services" even offers free laundry detergent. "Jimmy is just a ball of love and light, he has this energy and spirit about him," Cayenne Mandes, a school social worker and the teen's mentor on the project, told The Messenger. Six months after Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin went into cardiac arrest on the field after making a tackle in January, the NFL safety broke down in tears as he presented the team's training staff the Pat Tillman Award for Service for helping save his life. Hamlin, 25, handed the crew their trophy and embraced them on stage during the ESPY Awards in July. Nathan Breske, the Bills’ head athletic trainer, said it was the “best outcome we could’ve prayed for or imagined. ... We are not used to having the spotlight on us. We were just doing our job, but the idea of service is definitely something that is ingrained in our profession and that we take great pride in.” Hamlin collapsed after making a tackle during a Jan. 2 against the Cincinnati Bengals, and the Bills training staff performed CPR on him for about 10 minutes. He was taken to the University of Cincinnati Medical Center where he was released a week later. He played his first regular season game for the Bills in October. A couple — Scott Lehmann and Shayna Unger — made history in May when he became the first deaf American man and she became the first deaf woman to reach the summit of Mount Everest. “It’s hard to believe that we’re there, standing there,” Unger, 31, told The Messenger of their historic feat to reach the world's tallest peak. The two spent 30 minutes at the summit, taking in the stunning Himalayan mountain range from their vantage point on top of the world. “It was the most rewarding feeling in the world ,” Lehmann, 34, said. “It was just really a blessing.” The couple from Frederick, Md., who have both been deaf since birth, said Everest wasn't their first obstacle they overcame. “A lot of people feel like deaf people on the top of the mountain, that we don't belong there,” Unger said. “It feels like we defied all odds to be able to get to this point, showing that deaf climbers are just like everyone else," she continued. Country music legend Dolly Parton fulfilled the bucket list of a fan dying of stage-four colorectal cancer over the Christmas holiday. After being diagnosed in 2021, LeGrand "LG" Gold of Utah wrote that he wanted to meet the Queen of Country as part of his bucket list but feared that time was running out for it to come true as he recently entered hospice care. Then he heard the phone ring the Friday before Christmas and saw the Tennessee area code. "Hey, LG, it's Dolly P.!" Parton said. "Well, I've heard you've been a fan of mine for many years. I just wanted to thank you for that." Parton vowed to "travel on" with Gold throughout his journey and said, "Just know that I will always love you." "I should have sung that, shouldn't I?" Parton said, as she sang a few bars of her iconic 1973 hit. "I will always love you," Parton sang, "I will always love, LG." LG's wife Alice told Parton: "Best Christmas ever." A Georgia mother traveled nine hours to Indiana to hear the sound of her son's beating heart — and to meet the man who received the organ in a transplant. Leah Ozment embarked on the emotional trip in July on what would have been her son Thomas' 20th birthday. Her 19-year-old son died in a motorcycle accident in November 2022, and his heart was donated to Jason Summers, who needed a transplant after suffering a heart attack in April 2021. "The heart inside Jason was created inside my body, which is just incredible," Ozment said. Before meeting Summers, Ozment wrote him a letter, saying he will always be her family's "forever hero." "While my soul grieves the profound loss of Thomas, my soul has also tremendous peace in knowing that Thomas lives on through you," it read. Among the most stirring and heart-tugging images of 2023 were the return of some of the hostages kidnapped by Hamas militants when they invaded Israel on Oct. 7. Video captured the moment in November when Ohad Munder, a 9-year-old Israeli boy, was reunited with his father after being held by Hamas for more than 45 days. In the video , Ohad, who spent his ninth birthday in captivity, rounds a corner at Schneider Children's Hospital while carrying a stuffed animal and spots his father for the first time since being taken prisoner. He raises his hand in a half wave and then rushes down the hallway to his father, who immediately grabs his son in his arms and sweeps him off his feet. Later at the hospital, Ohad's friends held a belated birthday party for him, with ice cream cones. Ohad was visiting his grandparents — Abraham and Ruthi — in Kibbutz Nir Oz on Oct. 7 when they were kidnapped along with the boy's mother, Keren. Two years after a car crash left Noble Haskell with a devastating spinal cord injury and unable to move, the former Colorado high school runner was back on his feet, walking in a 5K race without the aid of his cane. Noble, who competed on the cross-country team at Smoky Hill High School in Aurora, was paralyzed when the car he was riding in with friends was rear-ended in June 2021. Although he was told he may never walk again, Noble dedicated himself to his recovery, spending hours in physical therapy determined to walk again. In May, he strode across the stage to get his diploma. And then he completed the "Nobles 5K" that was held to raise funds for his continued rehabilitation to cheers and applause. His mother, Kristi, greeted him as he crossed the finish line without the use of his cane. "That's Noble. That's the grit, that's the determination that Noble showed throughout his life but especially during recovery," she said. Brian Dooley , a star offensive lineman on Eastern Michigan University's football team, saw how teammate Zach Conti struggled to remain a part of the club, juggling multiple jobs and even selling his plasma to stay in school. Dooley gave up his scholarship in August so it could be awarded to Conti, who walked on the team in 2019. Without a scholarship, Conti was determined to stay part of the team and participated in off-season drills and practices during the regular season. He appeared in about 20 games. Conti had another year of eligibility and decided to play for the Eagles again. That's when Dooley, a team captain and two-time All-Mid American Conference offensive lineman, stepped in. “I’ve never heard, I’ve never seen anything like that,” EMU coach Chris Creighton told the team.

author: Sofía Calderón
title: ¿Reddit se cayó? Al corregir un error dejaron sin conexión a miles de usuarios
text:
La plataforma de [Reddit ](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/tecnologia/reddit-se-estrena-en-la-bolsa-de-nueva-york-con-el-pie-derecho-este-fue-su-repunte/)sufre caída durante dos días seguidos, dejando sin posibilidad de conexión a miles de usuarios.
Creado en 2005 por Steven Huffman y Alexis Ohanian, Reddit es plataforma social de noticias en la que los usuarios pueden crear y compartir contenido, así como votar, comentar y crear comunidades.
Durante dos días seguidos y tras corregir un error, Reddit se cayó dejando sin conexión a miles de usuarios en el mundo.
Reddit se cae dejando sin conexión a miles de usuarios tras corregir un error de software
El jueves [21 de noviembre](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estilo-de-vida/que-se-celebra-el-21-de-noviembre-hoy-es-estreno-de-wicked-en-mexico-dia-mundial-de-la-television-la-ascension-de-la-media-luna-dia-mundial-de-la-filosofia-y-mas-efemerides/), Reddit sufrió su segunda caída en la plataforma en dos días.
La página de inicio y los subreddits no estaban disponibles para algunos usuarios en computadoras de escritorio y dispositivos móviles, dejando miles informes en las redes sociales.
Reddit confirmó que la interrupción del 21 de noviembre, fue causada por una actualización.
De igual forma, la interrupción de ayer [20 de noviembre](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estilo-de-vida/que-se-celebra-el-20-de-noviembre-hoy-es-el-aniversario-de-la-revolucion-mexicana-dia-mundial-de-la-infancia-dia-internacional-de-la-memoria-trans-y-mas/), fue el resultado de un código incorrecto que introdujo un error.
Con base a Down Detector, una plataforma en línea que proporciona información en tiempo real sobre el estado de sitios web y servicios, informó sobre los reportes emitidos tras la caída de Reddit durante ambos días.
En su sitio web, Down Detector mostró la gráfica en donde se observaba los reportes de la caída de Reddit desde el 20 de noviembre, hasta el 21 de noviembre.
De esta manera, se mostró el repunte de reportes a las 4:00 pm del 20 de noviembre y a las 9:00 am del 21 de noviembre.
En donde, el 21 de noviembre, Reddit recibió el mayor número de reportes, siendo un aproximado de más de 69 mil.
Asimismo, en donde se presentaron el mayor número de reportes tras la caída de Reddit, fue en Estados Unidos.
Reddit se disculpa por la caída que afectó a miles de usuarios a nivel mundial
Tras la caída de Reddit por dos días seguidos, la plataforma emitió un comunicado en donde informaban que estaban trabajando en el fallo.
De igual manera, en las redes sociales oficiales de Reddit, ofrecieron disculpas mediante un meme.
Hubo un error en una actualización reciente que hicimos, pero ya existe una solución y estamos mejorando nuevamente.
REDDIT
Usuarios migran a otras apps tras caída de Reddit que duró 2 días
Luego de la caída de la plataforma de Reddit durante dos días seguidos, mientras arreglaban el fallo, usuarios decidieron migrar hacia las otras aplicaciones como X.
Como es costumbre, algunos de los usuarios reflejaron en posts que se tomaron de manera graciosa la caída de Reddit durante dos días.

author: Alelhí Salgado
title: Lluvias reducen 20% de la sequía en México; llenan presas casi al 50%: Conagua | El Universal
text:
Las lluvias torrenciales propias de la temporada favorecieron el incremento de agua en los niveles de la mayoría de las presas de México al llenarlas hasta casi la mitad de su capacidad. Así, la sequía redujo desde 73.19% hasta 19.08%, de acuerdo con un reporte de la Comisión Nacional del Agua ( Conagua ). Según el Comité Técnico de Operación de Obras Hidráulicas del organismo, hasta el pasado 15 de julio, el nivel de llenado de las 210 principales presas del país incrementó a 42% al presentar un volumen total de 52 mil 623 millones de metros cúbicos.
Del 15 al 30 de junio de 2024, las áreas con sequía de moderada a excepcional de la República mexicana disminuyeron 19.8 %, en comparación con lo registrado al inicio de ese periodo, cuando 73.79 % de México tenía algún grado de esa condición de acuerdo con información del S ervicio Meteorológico Nacional ( SMN ).
Lee también Clima México: Prevén lluvias intensas en varios estados del país por Onda Tropical 11
Esta reducción en la sequía está directamente ligada a las lluvias de la temporada y las provocadas por diversos fenómenos meteorológicos ocurridos entre el 15 de junio y 14 de julio, como el huracán Beryl que, en suma, fueron 63.8 % mayores a las registradas habitualmente en ese mismo periodo.
Sin embargo, incluso con las lluvias, las temperaturas no cedieron, pues del 8 al 14 de julio pasado se registraron más de 47 grados Celsius en Baja California y Sonora. Asimismo, el 8 de julio se superó el récord histórico de julio en Mexicali, Baja California , al llegar a 52.4 grados.
Respecto a la Temporada de Lluvia y Ciclones Tropicales 2024, el SMN dio a conocer que, de los 20 a 23 sistemas estimados para el ciclo en el océano Atlántico, se han desarrollado tres: Alberto, Beryl y Chris. En tanto, en el Pacífico solo se ha formado uno de los 15 a 18 pronosticados para el ciclo actual.

title: IAG New Zealand's Resilient Growth Amidst Climate Adversities
text:
In a recent revelation, IAG New Zealand has not only reported substantial financial growth but has also underscored its commitment to bolstering resilience against extreme weather phenomena, a pressing concern accentuated by the devastating North Island floods and Cyclone Gabrielle in 2023. Under the leadership of CEO Amanda Whiting, the company announced an insurance profit of $204 million for the first half of 2024, a significant jump from the $136 million recorded in the corresponding period the previous year. This financial upturn is attributed to an amalgamation of higher premium earnings, diminished costs from natural perils, and a robust investment income.
Financial Resilience Amidst Climatic Adversities
The Gross Written Premium (GWP) witnessed an 18.8% escalation to $2,015 million, propelled by rate adjustments in response to inflationary pressures and escalating reinsurance costs. This financial fortitude comes at a time when IAG has been at the forefront, shouldering over 52,000 claims stemming from the catastrophic North Island floods and Cyclone Gabrielle. The company has notably settled 99% of motor and contents claims and 96% of home claims, with the total insurance payouts surpassing the $1 billion mark. These figures not only reflect IAG's robust financial management but also its unwavering commitment to supporting its customers during times of dire need.
A Vision for a Resilient Future
Amanda Whiting, at the helm of IAG New Zealand, emphasized the imperative of sculpting an insurance business that stands resilient in the face of escalating risks and extreme weather events. "Our focus is steadfast on strengthening our business to cater to the evolving needs of New Zealanders, ensuring we remain a reliable pillar of support during their most challenging times," Whiting stated. This vision encompasses a transformative approach towards business practices, including heightened collaboration with local and central government bodies to mitigate flood and natural hazard risks effectively. The objective is clear - to ensure that insurance remains both accessible and affordable for the populace.
Collaborative Efforts for Enhanced Resilience
The path forward, as outlined by IAG, involves a strategic partnership with governmental entities, aimed at reinforcing flood resilience through comprehensive planning, investment, and risk reduction initiatives. This collaborative endeavor seeks to pave the way for a future where the adverse impacts of extreme weather events on communities are significantly mitigated. IAG's proactive measures and financial investment towards enhancing community resilience not only reflect its corporate responsibility ethos but also its dedication to fostering a safer and more secure New Zealand.
In wrapping up, the narrative of IAG New Zealand's journey through the first half of 2024 is one of notable financial growth, underscored by a profound commitment to community resilience. The company's successful navigation through the aftermath of the 2023 North Island floods and Cyclone Gabrielle, coupled with its strategic focus on risk reduction and affordability of insurance, paints a picture of a future where both the insurer and the insured stand stronger against the vagaries of nature.

title: Lula: Brasil pode ter indústria da saúde para competir com qualquer outro país do mundo
text:
Política Lula: Brasil pode ter indústria da saúde para competir com qualquer outro país do mundo 04/04/2024 18h04
Presidente Lula deu a declaração em Goiana (PE), em inauguração de fábrica da Hemobrás. Imagem: Leonardo Alves do Prado - 12.mar.2024/Estadão Conteúdo O presidente Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva disse nesta quinta-feira, 5, que o Brasil tem condições de ter uma indústria de saúde competitiva e que o SUS seria fundamental para o desenvolvimento do setor. Ele deu a declaração em Goiana (PE), em inauguração de fábrica da Hemobrás.
"Queremos um país soberano, capaz de ter uma indústria da saúde, porque nós temos o órgão consumidor que é o SUS. Que pode comprar as máquinas que a gente produzir, os remédios que a gente produzir, as vacinas. A gente não tem por que não acreditar que a gente pode ter um polo industrial na área da saúde para competir com qualquer outro país do mundo", declarou o presidente da República.
Além disso, Lula voltou a falar sobre inteligência artificial. Disse, dirigindo-se à ministra da Ciência e Tecnologia, Luciana Santos, que quer ver um projeto brasileiro para o setor até junho.
